Job Posting: 176527 - Position: S26 Software Support Co-op/Intern (28816) 176527 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/16/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/06/2026 12:36 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Nokia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Canada (Hybrid) 2026 - Summer S26 Software Support Co-op/Intern (28816) 176527 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $41,184 to $96,356 per year Position: Software Support Co-op/Intern Number of Position(s): 1 Duration: 4 Months + Date: May 4 - August 28, 2026 (Summer Term) Location: Hybrid in Ottawa Office EDUCATIONAL RECOMMENDATIONS Currently a candidate for a Master's or Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related field with an accredited school in Canada. Your responsibilities As a part of our team, you will: • Work with real-world scenarios that customers encounter when using NSP software in large-scale environments, gaining hands- on experience with the full NSP portfolio across a range of product areas and capabilities, while partnering with other R&D teams and Product Line Managers. • Identify, diagnose, and address product issues discovered by customers or during internal testing, and contribute to implementing effective solutions. • Leverage insights from customer use cases to suggest and implement meaningful improvements in NSP. • Create testing approaches and build test cases, which may include simulating various network management activities, configuring labs to reflect real-world scenarios, or developing automated tests. Job Requirements Your skills and experience Your skills and experience • Experience with Linux console environments. You're comfortable using basic Linux commands to complete technical tasks. • Programming proficiency in at least one of the following: Java, Python, Perl, or shell scripting. Familiarity with XML, Ansible, or JavaScript is also beneficial. • Strong technical reasoning skills. You're capable of identifying setup or system issues and thinking through possible actions to resolve them during installation or usage. Nice to have: • Curiosity and motivation to learn on the job, strong task management, and clear communication abilities. The team works on a wide range of projects related to NSP, providing opportunities to build knowledge across multiple areas. • Foundational knowledge of databases, virtualization, networking, or version control systems-these can contribute to your effectiveness in the role. Citizenship Requirement N/A Position Start Date Position End Date May 04, 2026 12:00 AM August 28, 2026 12:00 AM APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Special Application Instructions APPLICATION LINK: https://jobs.nokia.com/en/sites/CX_1/job/28816 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
